com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents

Class XMLSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.XMLSerializer

  • public final class XMLSerializer
extends Object
    Serialization helper class.

    XMLSerializer provides several convenience function for serializing fields (data items) stored inside a Plugin document. This functionality is especially handy when implementing serialization for a plugin document.

    Any XMLSerializable class can be serialized and deserialized using classToXML and classFromXML (or one of their variants). However, for final classes (e.g. SequenceAnnotation) it is more efficient to serialize/deserialize the class by directly calling XMLSerializable.toXML() and using their deserialization constructor if available.

    • Method Detail

      • classToXML

        public static org.jdom.Element classToXML(String elementName,
                          XMLSerializable object)
        converts the given object to an XML element of the given name.

        Note: For final classes (e.g. SequenceAnnotation) it is more efficient to serialize/deserialize it directly rather than using XMLSerializer.

        Parameters:
        elementName - the name of the element
        object - the object to convert
        Returns:
        an XML element.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - whose cause is a XMLSerializationException if either the serializable class is a PluginDocument and it is unable to serialize to a temporary file using PluginDocument.FILE_DATA_ATTRIBUTE_NAME or the serializable class is an AnnotatedPluginDocument which can't load its internal PluginDocument because for example there is insufficient memory or it is in a shared database that encounters an IOException

      • classToXML

        public static org.jdom.Element classToXML(String elementName,
                          XMLSerializable object,
                          ProgressListener progressListener)
        converts the given object to an XML element of the given name.

        Note: For final classes (e.g. SequenceAnnotation) it is more efficient to serialize/deserialize it directly rather than using XMLSerializer.

        Parameters:
        elementName - the name of the element
        object - the object to convert
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the serialization to XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        an XML element or null if the progress listener requests the serialization be cancelled.

      • classToXML

        public static org.jdom.Element classToXML(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                          String elementName,
                          XMLSerializable object,
                          ProgressListener progressListener)
        converts the given object to an XML element of the given name so that is is readable in the specified version of Geneious.

        Note: For final classes (e.g. SequenceAnnotation) it is more efficient to serialize/deserialize it directly rather than using XMLSerializer.

        Parameters:
        version - the version of Geneious to make it readable in. If this is not equal to Geneious.getMajorVersion() then the object must implement XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible and have indicated it supports serializing to that version via XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.getVersionSupport (XMLSerializable.VersionSupportType.OldestVersionSerializableTo)
        elementName - the name of the element
        object - the object to convert
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the serialization to XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        an XML element or null if the progress listener requests the serialization be cancelled.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • pluginDocumentToXml

        public static org.jdom.Element pluginDocumentToXml(PluginDocument pluginDocument,
                                   ProgressListener progressListener)
                                            throws XMLSerializationException
        Converts a PluginDocument to XML, handling the case where the PluginDocument may or may not implement XMLSerializableWithProgress. Also, unwraps any XMLSerializationException enclosed in a RuntimeException that the PluginDocument's toXML method may throw.
        Parameters:
        pluginDocument - the document to call toXML on
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the serialization to XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        the XML
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the PluginDocument's toXml method threw an XMLSerializationException enclosed in a RuntimeException
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

      • pluginDocumentToXml

        public static org.jdom.Element pluginDocumentToXml(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                                   PluginDocument pluginDocument,
                                   ProgressListener progressListener)
                                            throws XMLSerializationException
        Converts a PluginDocument to XML, handling the case where the PluginDocument may or may not implement XMLSerializableWithProgress. Also, unwraps any XMLSerializationException enclosed in a RuntimeException that the PluginDocument's toXML method may throw.
        Parameters:
        version - the version of Geneious that must be able to deserialize this XML
        pluginDocument - the document to call toXML on
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the serialization to XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        the XML
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the PluginDocument's toXml method threw an XMLSerializationException enclosed in a RuntimeException
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • classFromXML

        public static <T extends XMLSerializable> T classFromXML(org.jdom.Element element,
                                         Class<? extends T> cl)
                                              throws XMLSerializationException
        recreates an object from an XML element created from a classToXML() call.
        Parameters:
        element - the JDOM Element to convert
        cl - The expected class of the returned object. If it does not match, an XMLSerializationException will be thrown. This parameter is really just a convenience parameter to avoid casting the return result to a particular class and possibly receiving a class cast exception For example, you might use:

        PluginDocument result =(PluginDocument) classFromXML(element)

        but a safer way to do this is to use:

        PluginDocument result =classFromXML(element,PluginDocument.class)
        Returns:
        the re-created object
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted to an object for any reason

      • classFromXML

        public static <T extends XMLSerializable> T classFromXML(org.jdom.Element element,
                                         Class<? extends T> cl,
                                         ProgressListener progressListener)
                                              throws XMLSerializationException
        recreates an object from an XML element created from a classToXML() call.
        Parameters:
        element - the JDOM Element to convert
        cl - The expected class of the returned object. If it does not match, an XMLSerializationException will be thrown. This parameter is really just a convenience parameter to avoid casting the return result to a particular class and possibly receiving a class cast exception For example, you might use:

        PluginDocument result =(PluginDocument) classFromXML(element)

        but a safer way to do this is to use:

        PluginDocument result =classFromXML(element,PluginDocument.class)
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the deserialization from XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        the re-created object
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted to an object for any reason or if the progress listener requests the deserialization be cancelled.

        Parameters:
        element - the JDOM Element to convert
        Returns:
        the re-created object
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted to an object for any reason

      • classFromXML

                           ProgressListener progressListener)
                                    throws XMLSerializationException
        A convenience method. Equivalent to classFromXML(element,XMLSerializable.class, progress)
        Parameters:
        element - the JDOM Element to convert
        progressListener - handles reporting progress and optionally cancelling the deserialization from XML. Must not be null, but may be ProgressListener.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        the re-created object
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted to an object for any reason or if the progress listener requests the deserialization be cancelled.

      • listToXML

        public static org.jdom.Element listToXML(String name,
                         List<? extends XMLSerializable> list)
        Serializes a list of XMLSerializable elements which can be deserialized using listFromXML(org.jdom.Element, Class).
        Parameters:
        name - the name to use for the returned element
        list - the list to serialise
        Returns:
        a serialised element representing the list.

      • listFromXML

        public static <T extends XMLSerializable> List<T> listFromXML(org.jdom.Element element,
                                              Class<? extends T> cl)
                                                   throws XMLSerializationException
        Deserializes a list of XMLSerializable elements which were serialized using listToXML(String, java.util.List).
        Parameters:
        element - then element to deserialize
        cl - a class that all elements in the list extend.
        Returns:
        the deserialized list.
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the list cannot be deserialized for any reason.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

      • stringListToXml

        public static org.jdom.Element stringListToXml(String name,
                               List<String> list)
        Serializes a list of Strings which can be deserialized using stringListFromXml(org.jdom.Element) in any version of Geneious from 5.6 onwards. It manages nulls.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to use for the returned element
        list - the list to serialise
        Returns:
        a serialised element representing the list.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

        Returns:
        the deserialized list.

      • fieldValuesToElement

        public static org.jdom.Element fieldValuesToElement(String name,
                                    Map<String,Object> fieldValues)
        Create one jdom element containing several fields. The fields are values associated with some Document data item.
        Parameters:
        name - name of root element
        fieldValues - values to store
        Returns:
        jdom element containing all fields or null if the map is empty

      • fieldValuesToElement

        public static org.jdom.Element fieldValuesToElement(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                                    String name,
                                    Map<String,Object> fieldValues,
                                    boolean silentlyExcludeXmlSerializableFieldsThatDontSupportThisVersion)
        Create one jdom element containing several fields. The fields are values associated with some Document data item.
        Parameters:
        version - the version of Geneious that must be able to deserialize this XML
        name - name of root element
        fieldValues - values to store
        silentlyExcludeXmlSerializableFieldsThatDontSupportThisVersion - if an XMLSerializable field doesn't support serializing to this version, silently exclude it rather than crash.
        Returns:
        jdom element containing all fields or null if the map is empty
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • fieldValueToElement

        public static org.jdom.Element fieldValueToElement(String elementName,
                                   Object value)
        Create one jdom element containing one field value. The field value must either implement XMLSerializable or be one of the following concrete types: String, Integer, Double, Map<X,X>, List<X>, X[] where X is any other type supported by this method.

        Value an value associated with some Document data item.

        Parameters:
        elementName - jdom element name
        value - to store in element
        Returns:
        jdom element containing the field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Object cannot be XML serialized (see supported list of object types above)

      • fieldValueToElement

        public static org.jdom.Element fieldValueToElement(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                                   String elementName,
                                   Object value)
        Create one jdom element containing one field value. The field value must either implement XMLSerializable or be one of the following concrete types: String, Integer, Double, Map<X,X>, List<X>, X[] where X is any other type supported by this method.

        Value an value associated with some Document data item.

        Parameters:
        version - the version of Geneious that must be able to deserialize this XML
        elementName - jdom element name
        value - to store in element
        Returns:
        jdom element containing the field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Object cannot be XML serialized (see supported list of object types above)
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • getVersionSupport

        public static Geneious.MajorVersion getVersionSupport(XMLSerializable.VersionSupportType versionSupportType,
                                      Object... values)
        Helper method for implementing XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.getVersionSupport(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.XMLSerializable.VersionSupportType)

        Out of all values, returns the highest version of Geneious that any individual value supports serialization to via fieldValuesToElement(String, java.util.Map), fieldValueToElement(String, Object), classToXML(String, XMLSerializable) or classToXML(String, XMLSerializable, jebl.util.ProgressListener). Null values are ignored, and if the number of values specified (excluding nulls) is zero, then Geneious.MajorVersion#Version6_0 will be returned.

        Parameters:
        versionSupportType - the version support type
        values - 1 or more values to query what support they have for version serialization
        Returns:
        the highest supported version of all the given values
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • fieldsFromElement

        public static void fieldsFromElement(org.jdom.Element element,
                     Map<String,Object> fieldValues)
        Restore values stored in element by fieldValuesToElement(java.lang.String, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>).
        Parameters:
        element - jdom element containing the values
        fieldValues - the map to store all values in, indexed by name (field code). Any existing values are cleared from the map prior to populating it from the XML.

      • getFieldValue

        public static Object getFieldValue(org.jdom.Element element)
        Restore value stored in element by fieldValueToElement(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        element - jdom element containing value
        Returns:
        stored value

      • translateUrns

        public static void translateUrns(org.jdom.Element element,
                 Map<URN,URN> urnChanges)
        Translates all URNs (i.e. all descendant elements with attribute class="com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.URN") according to the given mapping.
        Parameters:
        element - Element to search and replace recursively for URNs
        urnChanges - a map of old URN to new URN
        Throws:
        MalformedURNException - if malformed URN encountered
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • clone

        public static <T extends XMLSerializable> T clone(T object)
                                       throws XMLSerializationException
        Create a copy of an XMLSerializable object by serializing and then de-serializing it.
        Parameters:
        object - the XMLSerializable object to clone
        Returns:
        a copy of the original object
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the original object cannot be serialized to a JDOM Element

      • ensureMemoryAvailable

        public static void ensureMemoryAvailable(long memoryInBytes)
                                  throws XMLSerializationException
        Ensures that at least this much memory is available plus a little extra (100 MB in the current implementation) to be safe, and if not throws an XMLSerializationException
        Parameters:
        memoryInBytes - memory that the calling code requires in bytes
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if insufficient free memory is available.
